sailpoint.object
Class NotificationConfig

java.lang.Object
  sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      sailpoint.object.NotificationConfig
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject
public class NotificationConfig
extends AbstractXmlObject

A class holding information about when and how to execute notifications, reminders, escalations, etc... There are three modes for triggering the initial reminder or escalation:

  1. Time after start: This uses an amount of milliseconds after the item is started to kick of the first reminder/escalation.
  2. Time before expiration: This counts backwards from a specified expiration time to determine when to kick off the first reminder or escalation.
  3. Max number of reminders: This is only applicable for escalations when reminders are enabled. After a max number of reminders have been sent, the first escalation will be kicked off.

IMPORTANT ADDENDUM:

This model has been updated to support multiple reminders and escalations per notificationconfig.

Initially only one reminder config and one escalation config were supported. Now there can be multiples of these. There are a lot of deprecated properties to maintain backward compatibility in order to support workflows etc from before.

See Also:

Get the frequency of escalations. Note that this getter/setter pair is suffixed with "millis" because the older setEscalationFrequency() method was used for something different, and this needed to be retained for XML backwards compatibility.

assignWakeUpDate

public void assignWakeUpDate(Notifiable notifiable,
                             java.util.Date expiration)
NOTE: this method is used to do INITIAL SETUP of notifications. Startdate is now and enddate is the parameter expiration

Set the wake up date on the given Notifiable using this notification configuration and the given expiration.

Parameters:
notifiable - The notifiable on which to set the wake up date.
expiration - The expiration for the notifiable.

reAssignWakeupDate

public void reAssignWakeupDate(Notifiable notifiable,
                               NotificationConfig oldNotificationConfig)
This is used when certification has already been scheduled. All the values like configs, startDate and endDate (on "this") is assumed to be already set by the caller.

calculateFirstReminderDate

@Deprecated
public java.util.Date calculateFirstReminderDate(java.util.Date start,
                                                            java.util.Date expiration)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Deprecated. 

Calculate the first reminder date.

Parameters:
start - The start date of the period.
expiration - The expiration date of the period.
Returns:
The first reminder date, or null if reminders are not enabled.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If expiration is null and reminders are based on the expiration date, or start is null and reminders are based on the start date.

calculateFirstEscalationDate

@Deprecated
public java.util.Date calculateFirstEscalationDate(java.util.Date start,
                                                              java.util.Date expiration)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Deprecated. 

Calculate the first escalation date.

Parameters:
start - The start date of the period.
expiration - The expiration date of the period.
Returns:
The first escalation date, or null if escalations are not configured or are based on a max number of reminders.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If expiration is null and escalations are based on the expiration date, or start is null and escalations are based on the start date.
